label: AB2_hP9_156_2ab_a2b3c-001
title: CdI$_{2}$ (Polytype 6H$_{1}$) Structure
comments:
This is the $6H_{(a)}$ structure described by (Mitchell, 1956). He did not list the atomic positions, so the atoms are assumed to be evenly placed along the $z$-axis. 
 This is an alternative stacking for CdI$_{2}$, which is usually found in the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_hP3_164_a_d-001}{2H $\omega$ ($C6$) phase}. 
 The \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_hP6_186_b_ab-001}{$C27$ structure} was also proposed as a structure of CdI$_{2}$, but this is now depreciated.
 (Mitchell, 1956) lists other possible stackings for CdI$_{2}$. 
 Space group $P3m1$ \#156 allows an arbitary choice for the origin of the $z$-axis.  We exploit this to place the first iodine atom at the origin.
